title: Development and Evaluation Process of Self-Directed Learning Modules for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theory and experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: As pre-service teachers (job seekers), learners must develop the ability to create and evaluate self-directed learning modules using mixed research methods and the PDSA model. The core task involves producing microlearning content optimized for digital devices and mobile environments.

learning_goals: Learners can design self-directed learning modules by applying the PDSA (Plan-Do-Study-Act) modelâ€™s four stages.
Learners can evaluate the effectiveness of developed modules using mixed research methods (quantitative + qualitative).
Learners can create learning modules incorporating UDL (Universal Design for Learning), TPACK (Technological Pedagogical Content Knowledge), and diversity inclusion principles.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
